top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 93, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Gravel One Fifty's dutch flat gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Gravel One Fifty's Dutch countryside, Flat gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 93 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel One Fifty's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel One Fifty. Train it until it feels boring.
When someone attacks on dutch flat gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
At Gravel One Fifty, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 93 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel One Fifty, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 93 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
The aerobic base that lets you ride dutch flat gravel at tempo for 93 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.
Long rides with hard efforts mixed in. Simulates what Gravel One Fifty's dutch flat gravel actually does to you.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel One Fifty’s 93 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel One Fifty requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on dutch flat gravel to build confidence. Expect: dutch countryside, flat gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 93 miles of dutch flat gravel in Roden, Drenthe, Netherlands.
